data.title: Life and Death on Hollywood Boulevard
data.meta_description: Back in LA on a short-term contract, I grabbed my coffee from the multi-tiered shopping mall at Hollywood and Highland and ambled down the steps to the Boulevard and the Hollywood Walk of Fame. It…
data.text:
Back in LA on a short-term contract, I grabbed my coffee from the multi-tiered shopping mall at Hollywood and Highland and ambled down the steps to the Boulevard and the Hollywood Walk of Fame. It was a whirlwind of activity, the busiest part of the strip. This is where tourists gather to board the tour buses and take photos of the more recognizable five-star brass stars embedded in the terrazzo sidewalk. Street performers dressed as Spiderman, Marilyn Monroe, Captain America, and others regale the street traffic hoping to make a buck. “Photo? Want a selfie?” they cry out.

I looked down at my feet, Donald Trump’s star had been vandalized once again, simple graffiti this time, not like in 2020 when a man in an Incredible Hulk costume took a pickaxe to it. The Hollywood Chamber of Commerce has had to repair or replace the star numerous times since it was installed in 2007 and has refused to move it to a less conspicuous part of the Walk despite requests from the city. The Hulk costume was a nice touch, I thought.

I headed east towards Vine, stepping over the more recognizable citizens of Tinseltown…
